business.headline: Capital gains tax was meant to be simpler. Here's why it feels harder nowSelling a long-held asset used to be a fairly predictable exercise. Inflation was factored in through indexation, the tax rate was known, and the final bill rarely came as a shock. That sense of certainty has faded.

What education sector wants from Budget 2026: Skills, quality and jobsWith India's youth population at the centre of its growth story, the education sector sees Budget 2026 as a chance to invest in better teachers, relevant skills and stronger pathways to jobs.

Tata Technologies' Q3 profit plunges 96% on one-time labour code chargeThe new labour rules, which came into effect in November, require employee wages to make up at least 50% of the total cost to company. Benefits such as provident fund and gratuity must now be calculated based on wages, raising costs for employers.

Gold and silver ETFs at record highs: Should you sell now or buy more?Gold and silver prices have climbed to record highs, pulling their ETFs up sharply as well. With returns looking attractive, investors are now facing a key question, i.e., is this the right time to book profits or stay invested? Let's have a look.

Will gold prices stay near record highs despite easing safe-haven demand?Gold prices are hovering near record highs even as some safe-haven demand fades, raising questions about whether support from interest rate cut expectations and global uncertainty will be enough to keep prices elevated.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by IT stocks; Infosys gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 187.74 points to settle at 83,570.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 28.75 points to close at 25,694.35​​​​​​​.

Budget 2026: What India's middle class is really asking forWith Budget 2026 around the corner, India's middle class is hoping for relief that actually touches daily life, from jobs and inflation to housing and healthcare, so what is it really asking the government to deliver?

Are frequent market holidays holding India back as a global investment hub?In a post on X, Kamath said that shutting stock exchanges for a local municipal election shows poor planning, especially at a time when Indian markets have strong international linkages and global investor participation.

BCCL IPO listing date changed: Check new debut date, GMP and expected profitBCCL share price: Expectations around listing gains remain strong, as the grey market premium, or GMP, has moved higher. However, the stock's listing has been delayed, pushing the debut to a later date.

IMF likely to upgrade India's GDP forecast after Q3 growth exceeds expectationsIndia's third-quarter growth turned out to be better than expected. This has increased the chances of an upward revision in the IMF's outlook.

Can Budget 2026 address tax, talent and cost pressures in tourism and hospitality?Industry voices highlight the need for skilling reforms, tax incentives, and policy support to drive growth and innovation in India's tourism and hospitality sector.

Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

Budget 2026: From mental health to medtech, healthcare seeks policy pushAhead of Union Budget 2026, voices from across the healthcare ecosystem are drawing attention to long-standing gaps. While funding has improved in recent years, experts say sharper policy focus is needed on mental health, medtech and early diagnosis.

entertainment.headline: I hate him, but…: Parul Gulati's surprising take on Karan Aujla cheating row Actor Parul Gulati has publicly voiced support for Punjabi singer Karan Aujla amid allegations of infidelity, dismissing accuser Ms Gori's statements as unfounded.

Javed Akhtar reacts to AR Rahman's remark on the film industry becoming communal AR Rahman recently spoke about getting fewer opportunities in Bollywood and hinted at communal bias. Lyricist Javed Akhtar disagrees, saying Rahman is widely respected and that his own choices are driven by artistic integrity.

25 years of madness: Akshay Kumar marks anniversary with playful reel of Twinkle Akshay Kumar and Twinkle Khanna celebrated 25 years of marriage with playful social media posts, sharing laughter-filled memories that continue to delight their fans.

AR Rahman blames Bollywood for his decline, but post-2015 duds hurt his legacy too In a recent interview, AR Rahman blamed his recent Bollywood slowdown on non-creative power shifts and communal whispers. Truth is, his post-2015 duds contributed to his decline.

Can This Love Be Translated review: Kim Seon-ho returns with a soft, fluent charmRelease Date:Fri Jan 16, 2026 Netflix's new K-drama Can This Love Be Translated treats romance as an emotional journey built on patience and understanding rather than perfect fluency. With its thoughtful take on miscommunication, mental health and intimacy, the show stands out for its grounded performances and gentle storytelling.

CBFC chairman Prasoon Joshi on the censor certification debate: Exclusive Prasoon Joshi said the debate over whether the CBFC acts as a censor or certifier is complex, noting that the board tries to balance creative expression with societal values. He stressed dialogue over confrontation, acknowledging the differing viewpoints involved.

Singer Shaan rejects bias notion after AR Rahman's remark: Music is merit-driven Singers AR Rahman and Shaan recently shared differing views about the role of communal factors in the Hindi music industry, sparking a public conversation on creative opportunities and industry dynamics.

The rise of the red-flag hero in Bollywood Bollywood witnesses a shift as flawed and ruthless leads dominate the box office, reflecting a new-age realism that resonates with today's audience. These anti-heroes, far from perfect, are not aspirational. They capture life's messy truths, and depart from traditional charming protagonists.

Alia Bhatt posts 2016 throwbacks, fans call it their 'favourite Alia phase' Alia Bhatt reflected on her successful year in 2016 by posting a series of throwback photos on Instagram, joining a trend where celebrities revisit their memorable moments from a decade ago.

Jennifer Lawrence says being called ugly cost her Margot Robbie's Sharon Tate role Jennifer Lawrence has shared her experiences of missing out on roles in Quentin Tarantino's films, including turning down part in The Hateful Eight and losing out on Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, amidst online commentary about her appearance.

Amitabh Bachchan regrets missed learning in technology era, reflects on ageing Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan reflected on missed learning opportunities and changes in work culture, highlighting the effect of age and technological advancement on his career.

Bigg Boss Kannada 12: Countdown to finale begins as house turns emotional With the finale hours away, emotions peak as the finalists reflect on life, journeys and what awaits beyond the Bigg Boss house.

Why Bollywood cinematic universes aren't always safe bets at the box office Bollywood has been betting big on cinematic universes lately, but the formula doesn't always pay off at the box office. This Cinematic Saturday, we dissect various elements like hype, content, star power and VFX that go into crafting a cinematic universe.
Explained: What BTS' new album title Arirang means for ARMYs Korean pop band BTS announced their fifth studio album, 'Arirang.'  Know all about the song and what it means for the ARMY.

My 1st tickets were bought by Udupi restaurant boys: Suniel Shetty on early support In an exclusive chat with India Today, actor Suniel Shetty opened up about his early career days. The actor recalled how his first tickets were purchased by the Udupi restaurant team.

Censor board chief opens up on Toxic teaser row, refuses to speak on Jana Nayagan In an exclusive interaction with India Today, the Censor Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chief Prasoon Joshi reacted to 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-ups'. Joshi refused to comment on Yash's 'Jana Nayagan' controversy.

Hangout buddies: Ranbir Kapoor, Aryan Khan's rare photo goes viral A rare photograph of Ranbir Kapoor and Aryan Khan surfaced online, quickly capturing the attention of social media users and fans as both celebrities continue to make headlines for their work in the entertainment industry.

Kareena Kapoor joins '2016 is the new 2026' trend, shares unseen pregnancy photos Kareena Kapoor Khan shared unseen pregnancy photos from 2016. The actor called it the "year of the bump" while giving a glimpse into her throwback memories.

Anil Kapoor on joining NTR and Prashanth Neel's Dragon: Second collaboration of three The upcoming Jr NTR–Prashanth Neel collaboration, tentatively titled Dragon, continues to generate strong excitement ahead of its 2026 release, with Anil Kapoor now confirmed as part of the ensemble.

general news.headline: Did India silently strike back at Trump by taxing US pulses?In the letter to Trump, the senators flagged that India imposed a 30% tariff on US yellow peas on October 30 last year. The move went largely unnoticed and was not publicised by the government, revealing the delicate balancing act by India.

Time to remove Trinamool's ruthless government: PM sounds poll bugle in BengalPM Modi also accused the Trinamool Congress government in Bengal of blocking central health schemes, and cited the Ayushman Bharat scheme. He asserted that it was time for Bengal to "say goodbye to this kind of cruel government."

War-like situation: Indians recount Iran horror as flight lands in DelhiSeveral Indian nationals returned safely from Iran following government advisories amid escalating unrest and communication blackouts. The Modi government's swift action has been widely appreciated by families awaiting their loved ones' arrival.

Trump tariffs behind rise in school dropouts in Surat?Trump's sky-high 50% tariff on India not only has dimmed the sparkle of Gujarat's lifeline diamond industry, but its impact also seems to have reached the classrooms as well. The domino effect has especially affected Surat, the 'Diamond City' of India, with several children dropping out of schools mid-session last year.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 14 | Epic Clash of Faiths: When Tamil Turned Mass MediumPundits and laypersons, Tamil Nadu confounds everybody alike. What makes it the strongest citadel of regionalism in contemporary politics that is now soaked in nationalism? Why is it a unique entity even among its culturally similar southern states?

India brings investments, but Pakistan...: US Congressman gives reality checkUS Congressman and a member of Donald Trump's Republican party, Rich McCormick, underlined that alienating India would be 'big trouble for all of us'.

Winning silver is losing: Mindset that made Phelps the greatest ever OlympianMichael Phelps has reiterated the ruthless winning mindset that defined his career, dismissing silver and bronze medals as losses rather than achievements. Across five Olympic Games, he won 28 medals, but insists only his 23 golds truly mattered to him.

BJP takes control of Mumbai for first time, ends Thackerays' 28-year gripThe BJP emerged as the single-largest party, winning 89 of 227 wards and surpassing its 2017 tally. The Uddhav Sena-MNS- NCP (SP) combine managed 72 seats. Contesting alone, the Congress secured 24, while AIMIM surprised with eight wards.

Rahul by name and nature: It's time to retire KL's Unsung Hero tagIt would hardly be overstating things to suggest that KL Rahul is trying to recreate, in a far more impatient and unforgiving era, what Rahul Dravid once stood for in Indian cricket. Quietly dependable and easy to overlook, Rahul has become a cricketer Indian cricket takes for granted.

Live: Trinamool looting Centre's funds, PM's pointed attack at Mamata BanerjeePM Modi in Bengal Live Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is in West Bengal today and will go to Assam, to launch major infrastructure and cultural initiatives. In West Bengal, he flagged off India's first Vande Bharat Sleeper Train and inaugurated rail, road and port projects worth over Rs 4,000 crore. In Assam, he will attend the Bagurumba Dwhou cultural event, perform Bhoomi Pujan for the Rs 6,950-crore Kaziranga Elevated Corridor, and flag off new Amrit Bharat Express trains. Stay with TOI for latest and live updates-

2 Kerala tourists drown in frozen Arunachal lake, video captures horror momentTwo tourists from Kerala drowned after slipping into the frozen Sela Lake in Arunachal Pradesh's Tawang district while attempting a rescue. One body has been recovered, while search operations for the second victim will resume amid harsh weather conditions.

Optics over humanity: Trinamool claims forces harassing people ahead of PM's visitAhead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to West Bengal, political tensions escalate with TMC accusing central forces of intimidating marginalised communities.

Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Has Khamenei crushed Iran protests using 5,000 brutal foreign fighters?Fresh reports suggest Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's clerical regime turned to Arabic-speaking Shia militias from Iraq to brutally crush the Iran protests. It imported nearly 5,000 fighters under the cover of religious pilgrimages to suppress the anti-Khamenei uprising. The spike in deaths of protesters coincides with the arrival of the militias. Protests seem to have been quelled for now.

Raping Dalit woman is...: Congress MLA's bizarre theory sparks row, BJP reactsA political controversy has erupted in Madhya Pradesh after Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya's remarks linking rape with religious scriptures sparked widespread outrage. The incident has led to demands for his suspension and expulsion from the party amid sharp criticism from BJP and state leaders.

When infertility was a whisper, she delivered hope: India's first woman IVF doctorDr Indira Hinduja delivered India's first IVF baby in a Mumbai hospital during the 1970s. This landmark event transformed infertility treatment and challenged social stigma around reproductive health.

How landfill waste can be turned into liquid goldDeep inside a facility in Chandigarh, a breakthrough in chemical recycling is unfolding. There is a unique process that transforms unrecyclable plastic films into high-value liquid feedstock for a cleaner future.

Pakistani jets on its radar, did Indonesia misfire on BrahMos deal?India is on alert as Indonesia considers buying Pakistan–China co-developed JF-17 fighter jets even while finalising a $450 million BrahMos missile deal with New Delhi.

These anti-heroes, far from perfect, are not aspirational. They capture life's messy truths, and depart from traditional charming protagonists.

sports.headline: Bangladesh players union chief receives death threats amid dispute with BCB CWAB president Mohammad Mithun reveals receiving death threats amid escalating conflict with BCB. The controversy follows players' boycott over disparaging remarks by BCB director Najmul Islam against their players.

Djokovic dismisses retirement talk, backs himself for Australian Open glory Novak Djokovic remained bullish about his chances during the Australian Open 2026 and dismissed talks of retirement. Djokovic will be stepping onto the court, eyeing a record 25th grand slam title.

Shreyanka Patil reflects on 14-month injury layoff after first WPL five-wicket haul Royal Challengers Bengaluru spinner Shreyanka Patil reflects on her five-wicket haul and comeback after 14 months out due to injury, following RCB's 32-run win over Gujarat Giants in the T20 tournament.

Not even 5 percent of Rohit's success: India coach slammed for remarks Manoj Tiwary calls out Ryan ten Doeschate for comments on Rohit Sharma, emphasising the need for respect towards the former Indian captain's record and warning against demoralising statements from team management.

U-19 World Cup: India, Bangladesh captains snub handshake amid political tensions India Under-19 captain Ayush Mhatre refused to shake hands with his Bangladesh counterpart during their Under-19 World Cup fixture. India and Bangladesh are in a political stand-off, amid recent controversial events.

Damien Martyn wins battle against life-threatening meningitis, shares beach photo Former Australia cricketer Damien Martyn opened up on his life-threatening battle with meningitis infection. The former batter recalled his days of struggle and thanked family, friends and medical staff for constant support in his first public statement since recovery.

U-19 World Cup: Ali Raza's moment of madness results in comical run out Pakistan under-19 fast bowler Ali Raza was run out in a bizarre fashion during their tournament opener against England in the Under-19 World Cup 2026. Pakistan lost the match by 37 runs as they failed to chase down 211.

U-19 WC live: IND (161/5 in 34 ov), India rebuild after Suryavanshi's exit India vs Bangladesh live score, U19 World Cup: (IND U19 - 136/5 in 32 ov) Kanishk Chouhan lifted the tempo with two boundaries off Saad Islam Razin, pushing India past 150 and giving the innings momentum as Abhigyan Kundu anchored at the other end.

Axar way ahead of Jadeja, don't know why he's not in ODI squad: Former India batter Former India cricketer-turned commentator Mohammad Kaif has questioned the selectors for not picking Axar Patel in the squad for the ongoing ODI series against New Zealand. Kaif hailed Axar's batting and bowling prowess better than Jadeja.

ICC News: Bangladesh Won't Play T20 World Cup In India Over Safety ConcernsOn this Special Report, the focus is on the escalating standoff between the International Cricket Council (ICC) and Bangladesh over the upcoming 2026 T20 World Cup. Bangladesh's Youth and Sports Adviser, Asif Nazrul, has confirmed that an ICC delegation is expected to visit Dhaka for in-person discussions regarding the country's participation. Nazrul stated that while the nation is eager to compete, 'there will be no compromise on the venue issue' as player safety remains the top priority. The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has maintained a firm stance, refusing to travel to India and insisting on playing their matches exclusively in Sri Lanka. Despite the ICC urging the board to reconsider, the BCB has cited security concerns as the primary reason for their refusal to soften their position. The programme explores the diplomatic and logistical challenges facing the global tournament scheduled to begin on February 7th.

Rahul by name and nature: It's time to retire KL's Unsung Hero tagIt would hardly be overstating things to suggest that KL Rahul is trying to recreate, in a far more impatient and unforgiving era, what Rahul Dravid once stood for in Indian cricket. Quietly dependable and easy to overlook, Rahul has become a cricketer Indian cricket takes for granted.

Virat Kohli prays at Ujjain temple day before ODI series finale vs New ZealandVirat Kohli offered prayers at Shree Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain ahead of the series-deciding third ODI against New Zealand.  Kohli has been in rich form over the past few months and has regained the top spot in the ICC ODI rankings.

Novak Djokovic at the crossroads: Why 2026 could define his legendary careerAustralian Open 2026: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic is nearing the age of 39 and will face a major challenge from Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz going into the upcoming hard-court major.

India vs Bangladesh, U19 World Cup Live Streaming: All you need to knowU19 World Cup 2026, IND U19 vs BAN U19: Ayush Mhatre's India and Azizul Hakim Tamim's Bangladesh are all set to lock horns in the Group B encounter on Saturday at the Queens Sports Club in Bulawayo.

The Phelps protocol: Swimmer reveals how he programmed himself for successLegendary Michael Phelps has revealed his system for achieving success. Speaking on Raj Shamani's Figuring Out podcast, Phelps explained how he programmed himself for success.

Lin-vincible: A 9-year puzzle that Lakshya Sen failed to solve in windy DelhiIndia Open 2026: There was heartbreak for fans in Delhi as local hope Lakshya Sen — the only Indian left in the draw — crashed out in the quarterfinals. The former champion lost to a familiar foe who adapted better to the conditions, suffering a fourth defeat in a nine-year puzzle that remains unsolved.

Doping controversy behind, Sinner sets his eyes on 3-peat at Australian OpenJannik Sinner arrives at the Australian Open stronger after a tough career phase. His comeback and maturity could lead to a third successive Melbourne Park title.

Shreyanka Patil, Radha Yadav combine to sink Gujarat as RCB extend dream unbeaten runWPL 2026, RCB vs GGW: Shreyanka Patil and Radha Yadav starred as RCB extended their WPL 2026 unbeaten run with a 32-run win over Gujarat Giants on Friday, January 16 at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Warning to Sinner? Alcaraz makes career slam ambitions clear before Aus OpenAustralian Open: World No.1 Carlos Alcaraz has sent a rallying cry towards his nemesis Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz has warned Sinner that his entire focus this year will be on the Australian Open, a tournament that he is yet to win on the circuit.

Saurashtra hammer Punjab by 9 wickets, set up Vijay Hazare final vs VidarbhaVijay Hazare Trophy: Vishvaraj Jadeja's unbeaten 165 helped Saurashtra book a place in the final of the tournament. Saurashtra defeated Punjab by nine wickets in the semi-final on Friday, January 16.

Shreyas Iyer back in T20Is, Washington Sundar ruled out of seriesIND vs NZ: Top-order batter Shreyas Iyer has made his return to the Indian T20I side right before the T20 World Cup. Washington Sundar and Tilak Varma have been ruled out of the series.

India Open: Home favourite Lakshya crashes out in 3-game battle vs Lin Chun-yiIndia Open: The Indian challenge at the India Open Super 750 tournament ended on Friday after home favourite Lakshya Sen lost his quarter-final match against Chinese Taipei's Lin Chun-yi.

Babar Azam wasn't too happy: Steve Smith on turning down single in BBL clashBBL 2025-26: Steve Smith said a tactical decision to turn down a single briefly caused tension with Babar Azam during the Sixers–Thunder clash as he opted to keep the strike.

Liverpool's Slot happy to welcome Salah back from AFCON despite earlier riftLiverpool coach Arne Slot said he was delighted to welcome Mohamed Salah back from Africa Cup of Nations duty, playing down reports of a rift between them just weeks ago.

RCB vs GGW Highlights: Bengaluru race to 3 wins in a row, Shreyanka takes 5Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GGW), WPL 2026 Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru raced to their third win in the tournament. Shreyanka Patil picked her first 5-wicket haul in the tournament as the Smriti Mandhana side continued to dominate the points table.

Hard to see how Delhi can host World Champs: Shuttler doubles down on criticismIndia Open: Danish shuttler Mia Blichfeldt has once again criticised the India Open Super 750 competition. In yet another scathing comment, the shuttler said that she was unsure whether Delhi had the ability to host the World Championships later this year.

World Champs will be a festival, doubters will regret it: Badminton India secyBadminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra dismissed the intense scrutiny surrounding the India Open, reiterating that the tournament is being staged as a test event for the World Championships, set to return to India after a 16-year gap.

Steve Smith goes berserk in BBL, smashes 107-metre six, joint second-fastest centurySteve Smith smashed a sensational 41-ball century, including a 107-metre six, in the Sydney Derby against the Thunder, recording the fastest BBL century for the Sydney Sixers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
